In machine learning, the model is given data without any specific output. It tries to find patterns and relationships within the data. 3. Reinforcement Learning: This is a bit like learning to play a game. You try different strategies and see what works best. If a strategy works well, you get a reward. If it doesn't, you get no reward or even a penalty. Over time, you learn to choose the strategies that give you the most rewards. In machine learning, the model learns to make decisions by trying different actions and seeing the results.
